functional_prediction.note: Truncating variant - predictors for missense not applicable

acmg_classification.evidence_summary: Null variant (nonsense) in a gene where loss-of-function is established mechanism of disease (PVS1). De novo in affected individual with confirmed parentage (PS2). Absent from population databases (PM2). Computational evidence supports deleterious effect (PP3). Patient phenotype highly specific for SCN1A-related disease (PP4).

variants.notes: Truncating variant in SCN1A, well-established cause of Dravet syndrome. This specific variant has been reported in multiple affected individuals in the literature.

acmg_classification.evidence_summary: Allele frequency greater than expected for disease (BS1). Computational predictors suggest benign (BP4).

variants.notes: SCN9A variant unlikely to contribute to phenotype. Common enough in population and computational evidence suggests benign. SCN9A primarily associated with pain disorders.

acmg_classification.evidence_summary: Rare in population databases (PM2). Computational evidence supports deleterious effect (PP3). However, inherited from unaffected father (BS4) argues against pathogenicity.

parental_testing.father_phenotype: unaffected, history of mild childhood febrile seizures

variants.notes: GABRA1 variant inherited from father who had childhood febrile seizures but is otherwise healthy. May represent reduced penetrance modifier or coincidental finding. Primary diagnosis is explained by SCN1A variant.

cnv_analysis.findings: No pathogenic copy number variants detected in epilepsy genes

mitochondrial_analysis.notes: Not indicated - phenotype consistent with channelopathy

summary.primary_finding: SCN1A c.4933C>T (p.Arg1645Ter) heterozygous de novo truncating variant
summary.interpretation: Pathogenic truncating variant in SCN1A, confirming diagnosis of Dravet syndrome
summary.secondary_findings: GABRA1 variant of uncertain significance inherited from father with mild phenotype - possible modifier
recommendations: Genetic counseling for recurrence risk (low given de novo status, but germline mosaicism possible)
Avoid sodium channel blocker antiepileptic drugs
Consider fenfluramine as additional treatment option
Refer to Dravet Syndrome Foundation for family support resources
